THE DIGITAL SOUTH @ UNC

Silent Sam Online

Scholars Involved:

James L. Leloudis

Cecelia Moore

Description:

In 2018, during the height of the protest to remove UNC’s Confederate monument, Silent Sam, Dr. Leloudis, Professor of History, and Dr. Moore, University Historian, created Silent Sam Online to help people learn about UNC’s history of that monument and Confederate memorialization more broadly. Teaching this history of the University and nation is an initial step towards a future that addresses and prevents these injustices to continue.

See Project's Website launch

Methods: Activism and Advocacy, Digital Publishing, Electronic Literature

Tags: Confederate Monuments, UNC History, Silent Sam, North Carolina History

Have questions or notice incorrect information? Email Amanda Henley, Head of Davis Library Digital Research Services

The Digital South is a collaboration between the University Libraries and Southern Futures at the University of North Carolina – Chapel Hill.
